intro: Miconia anisotricha, commonly known as the velvetleaf miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of short, soft hairs. It produces showy, clustered inflorescences with small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in the late summer and early fall. Miconia anisotricha is also known for its rapid growth and ability to form dense thickets, making it an invasive species in some areas.
